inn1.comm: 132kph, back of a length on off stump, defended

appeal for leg-before, but the umpire is unmoved. Should have been sliding down leg. There is pace on this pitch for the new ball. And seeing as it is new, it is moving about. De Kock plays all around an indipper and is struck rather high too
Bhajji moves quickly to his left and stops thoughts of a single to mid-on. Bhuvi kept this one fuller too, inviting the batsman forward
good length, nudged to mid-on again where Bhajji prevents the single again.
went a little overboard with the inswinger there as Bhuvi slings the ball way down leg. South Africa on the board
beats Bhajji finally! Oh, he put in the big dive too but there was just enough on this backfoot flick from de Kock to go past him and trickle to the boundary
punched! That was sweet. Two closer to 6000, and that would have served his confidence well. Stood up tall behind the short of a length ball and laced it through extra cover
darts the ball back into the right-hander, Amla is careful because the length is fuller and blocks
teasing line just outside off, and the bounce everyone has been talking about at the Wankhede introduces itself. Leaps into Dhoni's gloves as Amla leaves
short and wide, Amla tried to reach it with his hands but the memo had not reached his feet. No movement below the torso and that's why he plays and misses
beauty! An on-drive for the ages. Didn't do anything flashy. Watched the full delivery all the way onto the full face of the bat and gently persuaded it to beat the mid-on fielder

thhhhhwack! Past point before anyone even blinked. Did someone say he was out of form? Poor bowling though with Mohit affording width for Amla to free his arms, and then making the length short to sabotage himself further
full on off stump, tapped to mid-on
lovely, crisp defence to mid-off, where Kohli rushes in to keep it to nothing. Nice, tight lines from Bhuvi and it held its line this time instead of swinging in
poor follow up though, as he slides this down the leg side and the ball is clipped away to long-leg. Needs a towel to get rid of the sweat. Gripping the ball might be difficult here
picked away off his hips to long leg. Very little hope for success bowling there to Amla, to be honest

goes short, and at 135 kph, that is not the length to use on a pitch that is giving pace for the new ball. Pulled away past square leg. Not timed perfectly, but it shouldn't surprise that the ball still reached the boundary in this day and age
sweetly struck down the ground, but Bhuvi dives to his right in his followthrough to stop the runs. Reverts to a fuller length, but there wasn't much swing there
wheels away on off stump and Amla gets across to nudge it to midwicket.

ugly shot, but it still does the job. It was short again from Mohit, and Amla decided on the pull and continued with it. Got into the shot too early and gets the very bottom of the inside edge. How did it still get there? There is 6000 in his 123rd innings, the fastest batsman to the mark in ODis beating Virat Kohli's count of 136
good length ball on off stump, defended
why does he need to muscle the ball away when he can do that. Just brought down the bat and tapped the overpitched delivery to the long-on boundary. Just the slightest extension defence

short and wide, Mohit is doing everything a bowler should not do in the early overs. Dhoni grimacing under the shades as Amla picks another gap - this one between cover and point. Slapped away off the back foot

edged and taken! Mohit has see-sawed this way and that with his length. This time a back of a good length delivery gets a little more bounce. Amla thought it was there to cut with the room on offer, but with the ball rising up higher, it takes the edge and settles in Dhoni's gloves. Mohit just looks relived. Kohli roars from mid-off. And Wankhede goes "Indiaaaaa.... India"
back of a lenght on off stump, nudged to midwicket
long leg was pushed quite square, de Kock was aware of that as he moved inside the line of a short delivery on middle and off and glanced it to the boundary
good length ball outside off, de Kock wades forward and drills it to mid-off. Very well timed.
this is abuse on the advertising triangles straight down the ground. Good length ball dispatched so very sweetly as de Kock leans forward and punches it away
over the wicket to delivery a back of a length delivery on the pads, de Kock works it away to the left of mid-on
strays on the pads again and the single that was forthcoming to long leg is taken
digs it in short, right over middle stump too. De Kock watches it carefully, bends his knees and jerks his head away
short-armed jab through midwicket! The ball is certainly coming onto the bat here. Just a shade back of a length, but yet de Kock was forward and just clipped it through the vacant space
brilliant shot, but Kohli has denied what it deserved. Drove it on the up and timed the pants off it. But the fielder at mid-off moved quickly, dived low and saved a certain boundary

goes short, the yelp from Mohit clarified how much effort he had put in that, but all of it works against him. De Kock just swivelled on his back foot and used the height and pace on the ball to pull it mightily over square leg. No reason to keep it down
picked away to square leg, but Rohit who is inside the circle has got it under control
stays legside of the ball and punches it into the covers, but he did not have the room to time it well and Dhawan runs to his left to grab it
wanders down the track first ball and blocks
goes back to a length ball and picks it away to midwicket
loads of loop on middle and off, Faf steps out to the pitch of it and drives to mid-on
saw him advancing so he pulled the length back just enough. Not that he fired the ball in, Bhajji has been flighting the ball so well this series. Keeps Faf to a block to midwicket
well bowled again! Negated Faf coming down at him with a tossed up delivery that dips before the batsman can reach it
that was the quicker one, doesn't turn much, Faf goes back in his crease and whips it to deep midwicket
good length ball, with a hint of shape away from the right-hander, defended to point
overpitched, and Faf would feel he has missed out. Leans in on the drive, but he might just have flayed at it too hard. Finds mid-off instead of the gap past him
he has not had it his way with this lunging down the track business. Does it to the seamer and a little bit of extra bounce has beaten him all ends up outside off

oh, that was clever. Didn't see his feet move much, but he waited for this one. Waited just the perfect amount before planting the angled bat on it and slices it between point and short third man. Beautiful shot
chugs in to delivery a terrible short ball and Faf camps back and pulls it past mid-on. That should tell you how early he saw it. Surprise delivery, yeah no.
point gets a hand on it as Faf plays that lovely slice, waiting for the back of a length ball on the back foot
on a length from Bhajji and Faf stays back, waits for it to turn however much it does and flicks it to deep midwicket
slower through the air, and de Kock does well to wait for it and nudge it towards square leg. Maybe tossing the ball up a bit fuller, just a bit more from Bhajji
ooh, a run out chance! Bhuvi had a lovely bounce at square leg and he delivers a stinging throw as well. But it didn't hit direct and Faf is safe. Gentle little clip almost became trouble
loopy delivery nearly pulls the false shot. De Kock looks leg side but the ball wanders to the right of the bowler
gets down the track and drives to long-on
lovely flight - and he is bowling nice and slow too asking the batsman to make the pace themselves. De Kock is reluctant to do so as he blocks
fullish on off stump, Faf defends
gets down the track, but the push does not beat the bowler
tossed up on off stump, eased to long-off

nearly cleaned up the ump at square leg! The ball was darted into the leg side and de Kock pulls out the sweep - didn't bend all the way down at the knee because the length was a little fuller and the pace was a little quicker. Still excellent connection, and once Anil Chaudhary ducked out of the way, it thudded into the boundary
good length ball on leg stump again, nudged past square leg
gets down the track and blocks
good length ball on off stump, de Kock stays back and blocks to cover point
short and wide, slashed away to the point boundary. Easy put away

you little beauty! de Kock was caught with lead in his feet as Bhajji rips one past his outside edge. He had the batsman in two minds because of his length. And just enough action on it made sure it extracted turn
gets down the track and whips it to midwicket. Dhawan is the man in that region and despite his throw Faf has made it in with a picture perfect dive
wanders down the track and drives to long-on
that one was a little quicker, and de Kock slices it past point. Variation in length, variation in pace. This is engaging bowling.
pushed through on leg stump, de Kock goes for that 'I won't put my knee on the ground' sweep but only ends up with a leg bye behind him
easy put away as Axar goes short and wide. De Kock just camped back and slashed it away to the point boundary
gets down the track and lifts it over wide long-on
good length ball on middle and leg, turned towards midwicket
jumps back into the crease and whips it away through midwicket

beats the outside edge again, this is pretty offspin bowling. Helped quite a bit by the fact that Bhajji has de Kock nervous. This was on a good length again, but the batsman is still worried whether to go forward. Late in his decision to do so and to defend. That's why he is defeated
slugs this away past wide mid-on! Went after the ball with everything he had but ended up getting a bit of an inside edge. Mistimed for sure, but he will take the runs
taps into the covers and sets off for the single straight away to bring up his half-century
down the track, but Bhajji has pulled his length back and kept it to a defensive push
Jinxy at short midwicket! Rushes to his left quickly, dives forward for the ball and ensures Faf's little clip intended for long-on does not get there
strays on middle and de Kock clips it behind square leg
stays back in his crease and slaps it away through the covers
pushed back at the bowler
that is a short and Faf slaps it away to the boundary rider at point
flatter and outside off, de Kock backs away and hammers it to the cover point fielder
slides this down the leg side, didn't quite turn.
tossed up on middle and leg, turned to deep square leg
tossed up on middle, picked away off his toes to square leg

pulls out the scoop because Bhajji is bowling with loop outside off and getting the ball to bounce and turn. Now all of that would dissuade the batsman from that shot, if there had been a short fine leg. There wasn't
worked away through midwicket
good length ball on middle and leg, turned to deep midwicket
gets down the track, but ends up getting too close to the ball. And he was going diagonally outside off too. Cramped up, he somehow plays the whip past mid-on
tossed up on middle, de Kock clips it to deep square leg
gets down the track, takes the ball on the full, and drives to long-off
could that have been a googly? It was tossed up on leg stump, but de Kock was able to get to the pitch and whips it to square leg
goes back and pushes the ball back at the bowler. That was the quicker ball

back-peddles does mid-off, but the ball has lobbed Mohit Sharma. He has misjudged the catch. Thought he had the ball covered and was very late in moving. In the end, he could only get the fingertips on it. De Kock had shimmied down the track, reached the pitch and clubbed the ball away. Not with as much power, but gets away with it
flatter and quicker on middle,
goes back and whips the ball away to deep square leg
goes on with the arm, de Kock defends with bat and pad close together and gets an inside edge
runs down the track and whips it to deep midwicket
eases down the pitch and pats the ball towards mid-on. That will take us to drinks
stays back to a pretty full delivery - was the slider as well - de Kock managed a little bit of an inside edge to save himself from the lbw shout

stays back, waits for the leggie to turn, and pats it into the covers. Faf has been dealing with these quick singles quite a lot. So Kohli tries to cut his partner de Kock off at the pass with a direct hit. No such luck, and to make matters worse there is no one backing up and Mohit on the boundary misses as well
shortish and outside off, slapped away to cover point  on the boundary
tossed up on middle and leg, gets down the track and drives to long-on
another slider, I think. De Kock has spotted it early and sweeps to long leg
flighted on off stump, eased to the left of short cover. Kohli is the man diving this time, but it isn't enough to worry Faf into putting in the dive.
moves to 49 with a little help from the part-timer. Too full, too far down leg, and Dhawan has flicked it away to the long leg boundary
flighted on leg stump, nudged to deep midwicket
laced over extra cover! He is sweating, he is panting, but he is playing a wonderful innings. Backed away from the ball and lifted it over the infield

took it from off stump and cut it to the third man boundary! Oooh, that was risky, but he adjusted well. No turn on this flatter delivery, which was why de Kock shaped to cut. But even as the ball came on with the arm, he was able to bring his hands down quickly enough
tossed up on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg and Faf pulls his partner on for the second run
eases down the pitch to turn a length ball into an overpitched one and drives to mid-on
waits on the quicker delivery on middle and whips it to square leg
one-bounce and away she goes into the boundary at cow corner! Excellent batting. De Kock came forward to the slider and simply lifted it over the infield and bisected the two men in the deep
flatter and quicker on leg stump, he shapes to sweep but wears it instead
another slider on off stump, de Kock defends

inside out over cover! Gee, he is playing spin masterfully at the moment. It was pitched on off stump, and he watched it all the way. Moved beside the ball to make room and thereafter a full flow of the arms did the trick
backs away to drive to mid-off, where Dhawan keeps it to nothing
good length ball on middle and leg, nudged to long leg
back of a length and outside off, dabbed to deep third man
back of a length on middle, pushed down the pitch
too short, especially when he is bowling around the wicket and angling the ball in, pulled away to deep square leg
he has played this shot a lot on this innings - balance on the back foot, entire body still, and then the dab behind point.

mid-off was inside the circle and the slash from De Kock had just enough to lob him. Back of a length delivery had lots of room to invite the shot - plus de Kock is tiring so he is trying to get as many runs as he can - but this one is terribly mistimed. The bat turns on impact, but he had somehow got enough to beat Axar Patel running back
stands and delivers! This is another shortish delivery way outside off and he drags it to short midwcket
tossed up on the stumps, Faf defends
skips down the track and drills it past the non-striker to long-on. Loads of intent against the spinners from South Africa
flighted on middle and leg, de Kock works it to deep square leg
turn! Quick turn too, which should aid the spinners. Mishy pushes it through just outside off, Faf moves back to try and punch it through the covers. But he is beaten
getes down the track, Faf comes down the track and drives. Then he has to rush back into his crease because an angry Mishra flung a throw back at the keeper
worked towards midwicket

fine leg was up, and it wouldn't have mattered anyway. Poor line from Mohit - short and down leg - de Kock moves inside the line and helped it away. Just an up and over shot with a flick of the wrists and the ball lands in the stands beyond long leg
drilled through extra! He moves onto 99. A slight change in pace, it is the offcutter. But de Kock has cleared his front leg away and slammed it with the open face

fifth hundred against India and he punches the air even as he is making the run. Roars in delight, and gets a big hug from Faf. He has certainly enjoyed this innings - and it could be a pretty long one considering its only the 23rd over of the innings! By the way, this was a little tuck through to deep midwicket
oooh, thumped past mid-off! It was back of a length, but Faf got up on his toes to get on top of the bounce and punched it past a diving Kohli
oooh, beaten for the lack of pace! He was lunging forward to drive on the up, but the ball had stopped on the pitch and Faf ends up scooping it over the bowler
wide and outside off, goes for a slash and ends up with a mistimed hit to mid-off
pushed through down leg, Faf works it away to deep square leg
goes back to a good length ball and clips it to deep square leg
misfield at cover, but mid-off backs up well enough to cause hesitation. Plus de Kock is tired, remember. This was a backfoot push to a flatter delivery on off stump
drummed down the ground, it looked like four for all money but Dhawan from long-on was quick enough and put in the dive to keep it to a single
gets down low for the sweep and has made very good connection. Raina is taking evasive action at leg slip, and long leg is quite square
de Kock goes for the sweep again, but does not get bat on it. Why is the legspinner bowling on the pads of a left-hander?
short and rather wide to start off, Faf carves it to point
pulls away from taking strike, but Raina has not seen it. Bowls it anyway, Faf bats it away with one hand and it is called dead ball
goes back to a length ball and flicks it to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, worked through midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, driven to long-on
misfield at mid-off, awful one too by Rohit. Gentle little drive straight at the man, but he looked up just a second or so before he had the ball covered
fired in on leg stump, whipped behind square leg. Slider from Mishra again
waits on the good length ball just outside off and rode the bounce towards point
dragged short and Faf rocks back and pulls to the cow corner boundary. The boundaries, they keep on coming
flighted on middle and off, driven back at the bowler

slugs it across the line, did it carry to Rahane at short midwicket? Oh eaisly. Lunges forward for the slog sweep and it was hit very hard. The fielder got there, but before he could cup his hands around the ball, it burst through.
gets down the track to block the ball
good length ball just outside off, defended
well done from Bhuvi, stops a boundary by executing a little back flip with his hand between his legs as he was running to his left at long leg
gets down the track and drives to long-on to record his fourth half-century of the series, one which is only five matches long. Talk about consistency

taken at long-off and Raina has broken through! Came down the track for a heave over the leg side, but he has not got close enough for the ball to hit against the turn. Gets a hug from his captain as he heads off to the pavilion a tired, but probably satisfied man.
moves across on off stump, stays nice and low as he often does against spin, and drives to long-on
flighted into the pads, de Villliers caressed it to long-on
pushed through on middle and leg, Faf brings the straight bat down just in time
steps down the track for a clip through midwicket, but Axar has bowled it a little too quickly
oooh, he loved the pace on that! Saw the width early, decided it had to go and Faf lifted it over extra cover with the greatest of ease.
worked away into the leg side, but short midwicket got in the way
Mishy is the man there, and he gets in the action again as Faf gets down the track and clips to short midwicket
picks it away from off stump and finds a single to deep midwicket
fired in flat and Faf pushes himself back and slashes it past point. It was uppish, but he had found the gap to the right of the backward point
pushed through on middle and leg, clipped to square leg

tossed up just outside off, Faf was down the track but the ball dipped before he could get to it. Finds an inside edge to long leg. And at the other end, Faf takes a couple of seconds to catch his breath
goes for a reverse sweep, but this one is fired in quicker and flatter on leg stump. So he pulls all the power out of the shot and just lets bat meet the ball

short ball, sent clattering to the deep square leg boundary. Rocked back, wound up and just let go. Simply done. And while all that was happening, Faf has walked up to AB, looking quite drained, dropped his helmet and went down. Looks like he needs some fluids pronto
fired in on middle and leg, Faf cannot connect with the flick in time
oooh, so delicate. It was turning outside off, so he waited for it and dabbed it past Rahane at backward point
tossed up just outside off, Faf looks for the single to long-off, but Axar dives to his left and saves it
fired in on middle and leg, Faf was waiting to see if he can inside-out a shot over cover. No room, so he blocks
gets down the track and drives to long-on
opens the face and caresses the overpitched delivery through the covers
present a full toss which AB slaps to cover. A little misfield allows the batsmen a single
full and outside off, Faf drives to long-off
just back of a length and on off stump, perhaps looking for the ball that stays low, AB pats it into the covers
fuller and wider, AB pushes it to cover again
full and angled in at AB, swiped away to long-on
back of a length and outside off, Faf was forward but holds his momentum just enough so that he can flick the ball into the gap between midwicket and long-on
flighted on off stump, driven to long-off
down the track, but Axar has pulled the length back and that means Faf does not have the leverage he wants to heave it away. Pushed right back at the bowler
down the track and pushes to long-on
tossed up on middle, driven past the diving bowler on his right
a little loop there and Faf thought this was it. Came down on one knee and looked for the slog sweep over midwicket. Ends up with an inside edge
shorter and outside off, dabbed to short third man
there is protection in the deep, but De Villiers looks in great form. Driven powerfully to the sweeper on the off side
flat and back of a length on middle, punched to long-on
cuts from the stumps and he beats Harbhajan at point. By the time the sweeper catches up, AB has come back for the second
flat-batted down the ground to long-off for a single
faulty line from Kohli and du Plessis punishes it with a flick through mdiwicket. Picked it up and slotted it in the gap
hurls in a yorker at 98 kph, Faf just about smothers it with the bottom of his bat. And that's drinks, I believe
fired in on middle and leg, defended
gets down the track and flicks to midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, picked away to long leg
driven down the ground to long-on, and Faf walks his single. He might just be running on empty
ooh, that's almost a seam-up delivery but AB has eased away to one side and lashed it through the covers. Brilliant timing on the stroke, made it very hard for the fielder in the deep
this time he picks the gap. No one there at midwicket and he knew it. Also knew Axar will bowl darts on his pads so he raced down early and lifted it over the infield
back of a length on middle, whipped through the leg side
gets across outside off to meet the back of a length delivery and tucking it to long leg
saw the batsman racing down the pitch and sneaked in the quick bouncer. Faf sways away
mid-on was up, which meant even a tired swipe across the line gets near maximum results. This was short of a length, he clears his front leg and heaves past Raina
banged in short and wide outside off, Faf lets it go thinking it might be a wide. But it is not
back of a length and outside off, Faf is a shade early into the flick and it ends up at mid-on
tossed up a distance outside leg, AB leaves and takes the extra
flighted outside off, AB drives to the left of mid-off for a single
tossed up on middle and leg, nudged to deep square leg
top class stuff! This was a flatter delivery, looking for middle stump. But yet AB has jumped way outside off, whirls the bat down on the ball and the open face sends it to the cover boundary.
oooh, that was beautiful. The last ball was brute force, this one was a cheeky little reverse sweep. Content to simply use Bhajji's pace to get a couple to deep third man
run out chance? AB puts in a thumbs up and he is right. Nudged to deep square leg and he has double-timed it back for the second run
good length on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
shortish on off stump, AB waits on it and dabs it to a fine short third man
pats a short of a good length delivery into the covers
forehands it down the ground to Raina at long-on. Bhuvi tried to one-up the batsman, who was charging down the pitch. But Faf has been in long enough to win the play
slower bouncer, and with third man up in the circle AB was looking for the boundary over the keeper. Does not connect
this was mis-hit. It got way more height than perhaps AB intended. But these are short boundaries and they are cleared quite handsomely by a pull over midwicket
short, and perhaps slow again, pulled to long leg
tossed up on off stump, pushed back at the bowler
square leg is deep and he clips the ball that is angled into the pads to that man
backed away, an inch or so more and it would have been almost a bit too much. But he found the room he wanted and launched it into the sightscreen

oooh, Bhajji thinks this is a run-out after a dropped catch. Mishra is the culprit at cover point, had to move a few paces to his right but he spills it. Faf survives after playing an uppish cut shot. But Rohit is alert, he covers the ball and flings a throw to AB's end, hits the stumps direct but the SA captain has reached in time
picked away to square leg
flighted on off stump, nudged towards short midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Faf has dabbed to point for a single

top-edge six again! Way way into the crowd and that is his fifty as well. It was a short ball that cramped him for room, but it did not dissuade him from the shot. Went through for the pull and gets Wankhede to roar "ABD, ABD, ABD!"
the slower short ball this time, and AB moves away from it for a bit and taps it in front of point for a single
oooh, its an insid edge that sneaks past his pads and the leg stump and away to the long leg boundary. That was tough on Bhuvi and Faf even offers a wry smile as apology
short on middle and off, much slower in pace as well. Faf was going for the pull, but the ball bounced too high and was cramping him up. Chopped down the pitch
another slower short ball, Faf was backing away to try and lift it over the keeper. But the bounce there was way too much. Nearly four feet over his head
fuller delivery on off stump, plonked to long-off

flighted on middle and leg, Faf whips it away to deep midwicket. AB is running with his helmet tucked under his arm and Axar nails a throw from the deep. Direct hit. But AB was home and gets an overthrow to boot
flighted on middle and leg, almost a yorker too, blocked
cramps him up with the really full delivery on leg stump. Try as AB might - clearing his front leg - he only inside edges onto his pad
runs down the track, takes it on the full and hammers it to long-off. That's the hundred partnership, off 79 balls.
pushed through on middle and leg, pushed to long-on

heaved into the stands! AB has decided making room won't do with the darts on his pads so he goes down on one knee and slogs sweeps. Again, not perfectly timed because the ball went higher than longer.
back of a lenght and outside off, knocked to long-off and Faf passes a hunched over Mohit for the single. Everyone running on empty
does not matter how many people you put there, AB will take the length ball and pummel it all day. This one was hit perfectly. Right off the middle and it soars into the stands in midwicket
cramps him up on leg stump, works to deep midwicket along the ground
good length ball on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg. Faf on 98

slower short ball, that is not going to work with AB and the range he has. Jumped away outside off and heaved it over long leg. It was almost like he was facing the bowler running in from square leg - moved his body 90 degrees like that - and pulled the ball
back of a length and just outside off, dabbed towards long-on
shortish and outside off, cut to backward point. And AB shakes his head at not finding the gap
short and turning away as well, cracks it to deep point and places it well wide of the man so there is two on offer
takes the loopy delivery on the full and slugs it to long-on
gets down the track and whips it to deep midwicket. Looks to run as hard as he could, but he is cramping up big time. Only just about hobbled through
flighted outside off, driven to long-on

flighted on off stump, nudged through midwicket to raise his hundred... and a rather funny moment. He was trying to jump and punch the air, but the cramps do not allow that. Wears a grin as he celebrates the achievement. And so does the entire Wankhede. The crowd in every single game of this series have been amazing, must say,

thumped it! But Faf's cramps have set in quite acutely. He had jumped down the pitch to get to the pitch and launch it down the ground. But almost immediately he feels the pain and nearly crumples in the crease
drives through cover and jogs the single
flat and outside off, slapped to deep cover

eeish! He is tonking the ball around with great authority. But in the immediate aftermath, the cramp sets in. Seems it is his right leg. Shimmied down the pitch and clatters the flat, length ball out his sight. Out comes the physio in the time it takes for the groundstaff to get the ball back

another huuge six and Faf has crumpled in a heap in the crease! Dhoni is immediately there to try and help him stretch. This was a slog sweep, which meant his right leg was being put through the ringer. Soon after the connection he doesn't even get to admire it as he topples over on his backside.
full and wide outside off, Faf hammers it through extra cover and then leans on his bat to take the pressure off the injured leg
wide yorker outside off, AB jams it out and finds a single towards long-off

huuuuuge! Picks up a full toss - which means he does not need to move, helps in his state of cramps - and creams it over extra cover. Barely touched it, barely moved his feet and yet the timing was sublime
short and slanted into the body, Faf goes inside the line to go for a pull to long leg. Does not connect
full and wide outside off, Faf cannot reach that far in his current state. Specially seeing that Bhuvi outsmarted him.

one-handed! One-legged and yet he finds the boundary! This a low full toss - Bhuvi was searching for the yorker - Faf just leaned towards it and sort of flicked his wrists through cover. He could not hold the bat with both hands and yet... Sheesh!
this is a short ball, slower as well, Faf goes for the pull but cannot connect
shortish and outside off, cut away to deep point
tossed up on middle and leg, Miller tickles it to short fine leg and gives the strike to his captain, batting on 80
huuuge appeal, because Wankhede roars with Mishra. This is the slider that beats AB's reverse sweep. Impact was outside off stump. Excellent stuff from Chaudhary

ooooh, Rohit, you little beauty! This was a slog sweep, flat and hard to the deep midwicket boundary. Rohit had judged it so well, running to his right, taking the ball with two hands, but he was way too close to the ropes. So he had to drop the ball back into the field. So six saved.
races down the track and launches the flighted delivery outside off into the second tier of stands over long-off. Dhoni simply nods. He knows this carnage can't be stopped
and another, this one over extra cover! Skipped down the track, Mishra tossed it up wider to try and beat his reach, but AB will not be denied
diving effort by Mishy at short fine leg, but even though a boundary has been saved, the single is taken and AB is back on strike
high full toss outside off, creamed over the fielder inside the circle at cover. "AB, AB, AB," Wankhede rumbles
shortish and outside off, slashed to long-off
slower ball, back of a length, on leg stump. Miller clips to short fine leg and returns the strike to AB. And Wankhede  starts the chant again "ABD, ABD, ABD, ABD!!"
good length ball flirting a little bit too close to the wide line
yorker, but it is a bit too far wide outside off. AB leaves and the umpire calls it

full toss outside off, AB bunts it to long-off and Miller is keen enough that he calls A through for a second! Thats his hundred Wankede's lid has been popped. ABD chants every where and he bangs his bat against his chest and yells "Come on" himself.
length ball, smacked out of the park. He may as well be in the nets practicing for the slog overs. This one sails over deep midwicket. Slog sweep to a fast bowler. Jeez.
back of a length on off stump, knocked into the covers for a single. AB back on strike, the party continues
banged in short, goes for the pull but he can't reach it. Too high
okay, AB's concern is in collecting air miles! This was length, he clears his front leg and launches the ball very high and very far! That's his 10th six of the innings
six over point, slashed away! Rahane was the man running to his left and extending a hand in vain to try and make the catch. But AB's hit is too powerful

Oh, the short ball gets him! And Wankhede stands up to salute him. "ABD, ABD, ABD" they cant as he raises his bat to them. The Indians come to congratulate him as well. Now for the small matter of the ball that did him - a slower short one that he tried to pull off the front foot. Feathered an edge to the keeper
back of a length on off stump, becomes a dot as the bowler fields it himself
backs away to punch the short ball from off stump towards point
tossed up just outside off, Behardien nudges to short midwicket
gets down the track and pushes the length ball back to the bowler. Dots galore. Heh.

dropped by Raina and that is South Africa's 400 This was tossed up on off stump, Behardien could not get under the ball as much as he wanted so the ball sailed right down the long-off's throat. But Raina took his eyes off the ball too soon
slid down the leg side, Miller misses the flick, Dharmasena says wide to shut Dhoni and his appeal for probably caught behind down.
flat and quick on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
sweeps a length ball to short fine leg and sets off. The fielder sends in a throw, Dhoni shapes to collect, but just jumps over it thinking it would hit direct. No dice
short ball, offers Miller the room he needed as he pummels it well in front of midwicket. Brutal hit
another short ball, but this is at full pace and Miller likes pace. Stands, swivels and pulls it powerfully to deep square leg
short and wide and outside off - this one was a slower ball - but Miller is still able to use the pace and tap it to the third man boundary. Three fours to start the over
another short ball with all the pace drained from it. Miller has to wait with his bat high over his head and tonks it down to long-on
dropped, by the ball boy outside the boundary and Bhuvi now has a 100 to his name. This was way too short, way too high and pulled away
full on the base of middle, drilled to long-on
short ball, launched over the midwicket boundary. It keeps racking up
a wicket off a short ball, Bhajji has one in the wicket column. Behardien went for the clear the front leg pull, but did not get the elevation. Caught at midwicket
thumped, nearly took the bowler with it, to the straight boundary. Bhajji thought about catching it himself, but it was hit a bit too hard for his liking
tossed up outside off, lashed to long-off
fired it into the blockhole, Miller digs it out to extra cover
just a hint of width, and it has been carved to the man at extra cover on the boundary.

inn2.comm: crisp cover drive to start. Steyn gets a little bit of swing away, but Rohit has eased forward and found nothing to curb him from playing freely
back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
back of a length and outside off, patted to point

phenomenal appeal from Steyn as he delivers a quick, full delivery on middle and leg. Rohit is late on the flick and is struck just under the knee-roll. Should be missing leg stump, but Steyn is absolutely gutted. Appealed for almost three minutes straight
off the mark much to the Wankhede's approval. First runs at his home ground in ODIs is a boundary. Leans into the drive and picks the gap past cover
just back of a length, but it has slid down leg stump and Rohit helps it away to the long leg boundary. That man was inside the circle and deep square leg could not catch up
searches for the yorker, or at least he was looking for as full a delivery as possible. Defended by Dhawan
curls the ball in off a pretty full length, Dhawan manages to keep that front leg away and pushes into the covers
144.8 kph, that's quick and that's the pace where short deliveries give batsmen trouble. This one is outside of though and it is left alone
145 kph, the pace works in Dhawan's favour. Ball on the hips has been clipped away to long leg's right. Easy put away on his rapid outfield
143 kph Ripper! This was back of a length, pitches and seams away to beat Dhawan's outside edge. He is cauchg on leg stump, unsure what to do. The hands tried to adjust but he was beaten for pace
fuller delivery on middle and off, Dhawan pushes to short cover
back of a length and outside off, pushed towards point
138 kph, Rohit tries a flick, but the ball does not come on as quickly as he hoped. Finished the shot before it arrived and it hits him above the front pad
clipped off his pads to get a couple of runs before Rabada catches up with it wide of short fine leg
138kph, presents the full face of the bat to combat a fuller delivery on off stump
pacy! Its at 137 kph but the short of a good length delivery outside off seems to gain a little more bounce to beat Rohit on the cut
gets behind a shortish delivery on middle and leg and picks it away past the right of mid-on. But with the fielder running after it being Steyn, there is only two on offer
checks his drive as Rabada probes a fuller length. AB at mid-off catches up with it to keep it to a single
good length ball on off stump, defended
back of a length and just outside off, ridden towards backward point
creamed through extra cover! Just a little too full from Rabada and Rohit leans into the drive. Such finesse. Not even AB de Villiers had a chance

there was a noise as ball passed bat and QdK seems like he has dropped the catch. Yep. It was a quick, length ball that Rohit was looking to help it on its way. Only feathered an edge and the keeper did not get behind it. Odd seeing that he has pulled off some stunners in this series

148kph, ooooh, a run out chance and Rabada is none too pleased with the fielder's urgency in throwing the ball. Should have given it to me, he says. Rohit was going for an on the up cover drive, ends up with an inside edge that goes towards square leg. Dhawan had travelled more than three-fourth the distance and he would have been gone for all money had the fielder sent the relay in instead of going for a direct hit
back of a length and outside off, punched into the covers
shortish on middle and leg, pulled on one leg through midwicket. Dhawan wanted a second, but Rohit does not. But to his credit the "No" was loud and early
mild appeal for caught behind as Rohit goes for a pick up shot over fine leg. The noise this time was off the pad. de Kock didn't even appeal
back of a length and outside off, defended to point

caught at third man and Abbott has got the big one! Rohit was going for a heave ho seeing it was a length ball. But I think this was off the toe end which carries quite nicely to Imran Tahir running in from the boundary. Excellent start for South Africa
the short stuff continue, except Rabada is quite a few clicks quicker. Zips through to the keeper's gloves as Dhawan sways away
145kph, back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
151 kph brilliant delivery!  Its a ripper of a bouncer, looking for Dhawan's badge. He is able to sway away just in time. But this is some fierce fast bowling
147 kph, full toss on leg stump, that's what happens with all that pace. Sometimes it goes awry and Dhawan has clipped it through midwicket
beaten for pace and cramped for room by this 146 kph delivery. Quite late on his flick and wears it above his pad. Pitched outside leg though
shortish and outside off, slid down to deep third man
137 kph, just short of a length and it was pulled to midwicket. Mistimed because of the additional pace and bounce SA are generating
back of a length on middle and leg, Dhawan nudges into the leg side for a single
greeted by a bouncer at 140 kph, Kohli ducks under it
good length ball on off stump, tapped to mid-on for a single.

cracker from Dhawan. he is quite good square of the wicket. This was a cross-seamed delivery, seeking to get the extra bounce if he could. But all it does is sits up for Dhawan to slice through point.

quick, short delivery. Surprises Dhawan as he instinctively goes for the pull. The ball gets to him too quickly, and bounces too high for him. Top edge sails over square leg and trickles to the boundary
full and sliding down leg, Kohli looks for the flick but cannot reach that far
short of a length and outside off, punched towards cover

thuds into the second tier! Kohli says he does not worry about the short ball and says it emphatically. Its a short ball that he picks up early - so early that he almost top edged it - and pulls to the deep square leg boundary
back of a length and outside off, defended

chases the wide one and edges it again! de Kock, take a bow. That is a catch that will be replayed forever. He might well be the best ODI keeper around right now. Rabada goes full, Kohli has to reach for it because he is lead-footed. It was a run-scoring opportunity because it is almost an overpitched delivery. But the extra pace seems to work against the batsman. Big nick, which means it hurtles between slip and the keeper. de Kock flings himself full length to his right and plucks it with one hand
good length ball on middle and leg, nudged past mid-on
fuller delivery on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
back of a length and outside off, tapped to point
back of a length and outside off, slid down to deep third man
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed down the ground past mid-off

confusion, reluctance, nervousness. It's all apparent in this little bit of running. Dhawan set off, but Rahane was not sure. Then suddenly both batsmen decided there was actually a run after the pat to point. In the end, it was an easy one
inside edge, but the pads saves his stumps. This was full and on fourth stump. Dhawan is rooted on leg stump and goes at it with just his hands. Could easily have dragged on
full and wide outside off, Dhawan drills it to cover
goes for the flay through the covers, but he did not get the timing right. Only a single

138 kph, absolute ripper! It hits a length and decks away at pace. Dhawan who has got into his habit of batting on leg stump and staying rooted on leg stump had no chance. Especially with him bring an closed face down
back of a length and outside off, punched to cover point. There are three fielders in that region
good length ball on off stump, drilled to mid-off where AB dives and keeps it to a single
fuller delivery outside off, Rahane comes forward to drive and finds a single to AB's left
back of a length on middle, Dhawan tries to force it down the ground, but he cannot get it past the bowler
starts short and wide and Rahane cuts to the sweeper
back of a length and outside off, driven to long-off
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
works the length ball towards midwicket and sets off for the single. Became risky because AB was the fielder, swooping on the ball, pick up one handed and releasing it in mid-air
fuller delivery on middle and leg, nudged through midwicket
full on off stump, drilled to long-off
works the ball off his hips to deep square leg. Short of a length as is the South African staple
length ball just outside off, Rahane looks to capitalise but he mistimes the heave to mid-on

don't think he got all of that either, sounded like a dull plonk instead of the sweet crack. The impact extra pace can get - this was 142kph - Rahane has pulled it past midwicket and into the boundary
143 kph, just back of a length and outside off. Rahane wafts uncertainly and is beaten

one-bounce four to long leg. That was excellent batting. He used all of Steyn's pace, and made sure the short ball was punished. Did not rise up to threatening height, and Rahane just picked the gap and got the results
good length on off stump, sweetly struck to mid-off
good length ball on off stump, blocked to the bowler
this one is driven to long-off for a single as the required run-rate nears 10

Elgar runs in from deep square leg, he dives forward, but cannot get under it in time. Rahane was looking for a flick against a full toss, but he had played at it too early. Had quite a bit of hang time so Elgar should really have pouched it. Must have misjudged it
good length ball on middle, nudged into the leg side

phew, you cannot keep him out of the game. AB has nailed a direct hit but Rahane is too quick! Excellent running from him. Put in the drive and the only thing that was ground was his bat - his body was in the air and he was in full stretch. The shot, of course, was a tap into the covers. Now to the fielding. AB moved to his right, got a decent bounce and threw it immediately as he collected it. What an athlete
pushed to long-off

dropped by Miller at point. This was a fuller delivery that Dhawan went after. Got an outside edge, came at a just over head-height and to his right. But the fielder is slow to move. Are they not picking up the ball from the crowd?
length ball at 145 kph, Rahane plants his front leg and hammers it down the ground to long-on. Excellent hit
"A-jink-ya, A-jink-ya" chant the crowd and he treats them to a pristine off drive. Steps forward and barely defended it. Still it had the timing to beat a diving AB
back of a length and outside off, Rahane is caught in the crease as he pokes outside off and is beaten
full on off stump, Rahane gets down with it and slices to point
full on off stump, pushed to mid-off
goes on the bounce to long-on as he picks up a length ball on off stump
goes for a sweep, he misses the ball completely but the bat soars out of his hands and lands somewhere in square leg. Calls for a new grip immediately
full on off stump, driven to long-on

well done, he has picked the gap between backwards point and short third man. Threading the needle almost, especially seeing as Behardien does not have much pace. That's how good Dhawan can be square on the off side
back of a length on off stump, defended
shortish on middle, sweep-pulled to deep square leg.
pushed through on off stump, Rahane drives to long-off
that seemed like the googly, Dhawan picked it and drives fluently through the covers
flighted on off stump, driven to long-on
full on off stump, driven to long-off
flighted on middle and leg, Rahane taps it to long-on. That will be drinks
drops it short and Dhawan pulls to deep square leg
full on the off stump and Dhawan pushes it down to long off
almost in the block hole on off and Rahane digs it out to long
just outside off, hardly any width and Dhawan reverse-taps it very fine on the off side to beat short third man for four
width this time and Dhawan steers it with the angle past backward point for one
fullish outside off and Rahane chips it in the air but safely down to long off
bit of late inswing as Dhawan drives it down but gets an inside edge onto his front pad
he takes two small steps down and lofts it by taking it on the full, easily over long on for a six! Off the middle of the bat
angling in towards middle and leg, pushed to midwicket for one
full outside off, steered late to short third man
googly from middle to off, Dhawan waits for it to turn and pushes into the covers for one
big appeal from Tahir as Rahane misses the googly and is hit in front of leg but it was going down leg. Also survived a run out chance as he came down but was sent back
googly to end the over too, Rahane defends it back to Tahir
moves to 49 with a little help from the bowler. Its too full, too far down leg and it's helped to the long leg boundary
there is his fifty, with a dab to backward point. He's not had the best series so far, but he has a score now. Not much in the way of celebration. Just a little glove love from his partner
full on off stump, pushed back at the bowler
full and outside off, knocked back at the bowler again. Went into the cover drive a bit too early and gets it more off the inside half
driven sweetly to long-off as Behardien overpitches
fuller delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off and he converts a quick singly. Still was risky
gets down the track and punches the ball to long-off for a single even as the required rate rises towards 11. There is more than half the innings left

scooped up, and it is not quite as well struck. The ball travels much of the distance in the air, no chance of catching it. But with this being such a short boundary, Miller needs to pull off a bit of acrobatics. Runs around, there was a point where his right foot touches the rope, but at the time he knocked the ball back in the field of play, the foot was in the air
oooh, the slice nearly carried to point. Legspin from Tahir and he lands it very nicely too. Just enough distance away from the batsman who was lunging forward.
swept to fine leg, despite the ball being rather quick
powerful sweep and it races away to the square leg boundary. Excellent footwork made that shot, reaching as far forward as he could to take it on the half-volley
driven to long-off for the ninth run of the over.
loopy full toss, slower ball gone wrong, and Dhawan had premeditated the sweep. Tried to adjust the shot, but still did not make contact with bat. Gloves it for a single
shimmies down the pitch, almost yorks himself doing so, and drills it back down the pitch. Behardien leaps up to stop it

Oh, this is a good shot! Smears it through the covers to bring up his fifty in front of his home crowd. Raucous ovation. Overpitched and he was able to beat the fielder inside the circle and Morris on the boundary
full on middle and leg, clipped away past midwicket. Lovely timing again and it needed a dive from the deep fielder once more
Steyn does well at short fine leg, dives to his left to stop what could have been a boundary. Neat little clip to a ball wandering down leg
fuller delivery on off stump, defended to long-off
fuller delivery on off stump, driven to long-off

top shot! Jumps out of the track, makes a little room to free the arms and launches the ball straight over the bowler's head. "A-jink-ya, A-jink-ya, A-jink-ya!" The roars resume as the 100 partnership is up
whipped away towards midwicket and Rahane sets off for a single, Dhawan is not so keen and sends him back just in time before the throw can cause damage
looks to jump down the track again, but only ends up yorking himself.
oh, only just! picked up the googly and slog sweeps the ball. David Miller in the deep leapt and was stuck a hand out - must have been at lest four feet off the ground - but he could not pull it back
turned away through midwicket to retain strike

dreadful misfield from Tahir at short fine leg. Just did not want to bend down. Bad mistake, to top off another bad mistake from the bowler - delivery way down leg. Rahane just swipes it to the long leg boundary
back of a length and outside off, Rahane pats it to deep third man

goes across the line with a flick as Rabada angles the fuller ball across the left-hander. Leading edge presents a chance but has the fielder hurt himself in the process of taking a great old catch? Hashim Amla it is. Everyone is checking on him. It looks like he is bleeding just above his left eye. His head thudded fliush into the ground after he completed the catch. Ouch, that looked bad. But still he was able to hold on.
of course he is met by the short ball. Right over middle, and Raina ducks under it
moves inside the line of a short ball and pulls it to long leg.
short and wide, Rahane has launched it over point and it trickles to the boundary before the sweeper cover can get around in time
tossed up on off stump, driven back at the bowler. Tahir does well
pop goes the weasel! This was the legspinner, on a length, and Raina has pulled out the slog sweep over midwicket. That is his go to shot and he has hit it with the turn there
shorter and outside off, chopped into the covers
fuller delivery on middle and off, defended
gets down the track and blocks
goes for the slice over point, another one of his favourite shots and he plays with the turn again because it is the googly. Yet it becomes an outside edge that just about lobs short third man
short and wide outside off, which works considering Raina was backing away outside leg. Can only leave the ball thereafter

shortish on middle and off, Raina moves across outside off and drops it onto the midwicket boundary. Flick of the wrists and no intention of keeping it down. Seemed to be expecting the short ball, but adjusted well enough
another lovely short ball, but with Raina making room the umpires are lenient with Rabada going down leg
shortish and outside off, slapped to point

moved too far across, worried about the short ball, but this is the deadly leg-stump yorker that sneaks past him and clatters his castle! Rabada showing he has smarts to go with his raw ability. Gets a big ol hug from his captain AB de Villiers. Pace is pace, even on flat wickets.
full and wide outside off, cracked to extra cover where AB does not let it pass

but Rahane is in fine form, takes the shortish delivery on the front foot and slams it to the deep midwicket boundary. That was how he got out in Rajkot, coming in at No. 6. Now he has had time in the middle so he connects fat better
very well played again! With the gap at midwicket plugged, Rahane has waited a lot longer for the short ball and pulled it behind square leg. Excellent placement
short and a shade wider outside off, Rahana dabs it to deep third man
short and wide. cuts to deep third man
short, and slower, Rahane waited for it and pulls to deep midwicket. Two taken with Dhoni being fresh in the middle
shortish and just outside off, Rahane watches it all the way onto his bat - which is angled - and finds a single to deep third man
runs down the track and heaves the 140 kph delivery to mid-on

pace works again. Sheer express and accurate pace. This is short on middle, Rahane has to go for the big hit. Launches it over midwicket, but there is a man in the deep and he collects the simplest of catches. Steyn pops a vein celebrating, as per. South Africa are nearing yet another away series win
back of a length and just outside off, Dhoni knocks it back at the bowler
full on off stump, defended into the covers
142kph, full and fast, but it is down the leg side
140kph, gets up off his toes to get on top of a short of a length delivery on off stump. Taps into midwicket
gets a bottom edge past the second slip to make it the only run off the bat in that over. A wide, and a wicket in it. Dale Steyn. Always got it

direct hit from point, but Dhoni was well home. This was short of a length, cramping him up and rising up at him to make sure he can't pull it away. So Dhoni can only tap it in front of point and set off
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the covers
opens the face to send the back of a length delivery to deep third man
rapid short delivery, Dhoni goes for the pull and he is usually good on that stroke. But this time he is beaten for pace. Soars past his left ear and into the keeper's gloves

another misjudgment from Elgar and a catch goes down. It's a length delivery outside off and Dhoni flayed at it. Got the outside half of the bat, and the very bottom of it too, and it soared up towards sweeper cover. Elgar ran in, but should have come in a lot further before the dive. Explains that the ball dipped on him after he comes up short
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the covers
drives to cover as he meets the 144 kph short of a good length ball on the back foot
pushes it through the covers again
drilled down the ground, Steyn has got a good boot on it to keep it to a single.
goes short and Axar is able to pull it well in front of point to deep midwicket
goes for the short ball, outside off, Axar sways away
all too simple for Steyn. He yells until he loses his voice after Axar slices a short ball straight at point.
goes for the short ball just outside off, Dhoni goes for the cut but bottom edges it to the keeper
one-bounce and into the boundary at midiwcket. Good short ball from Abbot, came up near chest high, but Dhoni had a little room to work with and he got his hands high and hammers it away
another pull shot, this one to deep square leg and up comes the 200. South Africa at this point were 207 for 2.
back of a length and just outside off, blocked
full on off stump, Bhajji is rooted to the crease to get an inside edge onto pad
full on off stump, pushed to mid-on
full and wide outside off, sliced to deep point
tapped away to cover, that's a third for Steyn. It was a short of a length delivery, but Bhajji was into the push a bit too quickly. Ball held up in the pitch and became his downfall.
good length ball outside off, defended.
has that taken the glove? Bhuvi was ducking into the short ball, took the glove, then took the shoulder and lobbed to the wicketkeeper. De Kock runs forward, dives, but could not pull it off.
141 kph bouncer on middle, Bhuvi sinks below it a little quicker
shortish and outside off, tapped into the covers
well wide of off stump, back of a length, Dhoni looks to clobber that down the ground, mistimes it for a single
fuller, on middle and leg, pushed towards long-on for a single
length ball around off, driven off the front foot towards extra cover, no run
full and outside off, dug out towards mid-off for a single
on off stump, patted back towards the bowler
length ball angling in, driven towards mid-on
back of a length ball around off, pushed back towards the bowler
drops it short, hacks that away towards deep midwicket, a sliding stop there
dhoni skips down the track to get near the pitch of the ball, pushed back towards the bowler
full toss on middle and leg, Dhoni lashes it towards long-on for two
way outside off, much too far outside off
pitching on a length and around leg stump, clipped towards square leg

drops it a touch short, Bhuvneshwar looks to swipe it from way outside off, hits near the bottom of the bat and holes out to Miller, India sinking fast but the crowd singing "Sachin, Sachin" as the giantscreen shows Tendulkar in the stands
full ball angling in towards leg stump, eased towards long-on
worked towards deep midwicket this time
a Dhoni special, brute force there, a full ball is murdered down the ground, the umpire was dancing to get his feet out of that scorching hit
down the leg side, helped along to the fine-leg boundary, easy runs this for Dhoni
full ball on off stump, Dhoni reaches out and works it towards deep extra cover
full ball once more, outside off, driven by Mishra towards extra cover
drags it short, and that is thumped towards dee midwicket, not too well timed though

got 'im! the Tahir googly is too good for Dhoni, he was charging down the pitch, but doesn't expect the ball to spin in, it slips past the inside edge and on to the stumps, this game is heading for a quick close now
length ball on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
goes for the big sweep, bottom edges it on to his boot
googly starting from well outside off, bounces a bit more than Mohit expects, cut towards backward point
works this towards backward point once more
Rabada begins with a wide down the leg side
length ball around off, defended to the off side from within the crease
cuts in towards the pads, Mishra plays it from inside the crease, hit on the thigh pad as he looks to work it to square leg
blocked out towards the off side
again the pace of Rabada pushing Mishra back, length ball angling in, Mishra looks to tuck it to the leg side, can't get much bat on it

bravado from Mishra, or foolhardiness, he backs away from the stumps and throws his bat at that one, aiming the slog towards deep midwicket, he gets a top edge that flies high between the keeper and slip

great reply from the standout bowler of the series Kagiso Rabada, a yorker that is much too good for the tailender, plumb in front, and South Africa complete their first bilateral series victory in India with something close to the perfect performance. The margin of victory is an astonishing 214 runs!
